TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE . PERSON is the mother of the other CARDINAL applicants .

CARDINAL . From DATE onwards PERSON lived in a house together with PERSON , her husband , PERSON , her mother in law , and PERSON . In DATE PERSON was born . In DATE PERSON acquired a property title over the said house . In DATE PERSON died . In DATE PERSON concluded a deed of gift with Mr GPE and transferred the ownership over the house to him .

CARDINAL . In DATE PERSON instituted proceedings in ORG against PERSON and Mr O.O. on her own behalf and on behalf of the other CARDINAL applicants seeking division of the house and partial invalidation of the deed of gift .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered a forensic examination and suspended the proceedings .
CARDINAL . Having received the results of the examination on DATE , the court resumed the proceedings on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found in part for the applicants .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON and Mr O.O. appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG returned the appeal to the first instance court due to procedural shortcomings . On DATE and DATE the first instance court allowed the appellants time to rectify their appeal . Finally , on DATE the first instance court rejected that appeal without examination due to its procedural shortcomings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court of appeal quashed that decision and remitted the case to the first instance court for a decision on the admissibility of the appeal lodged by PERSON and Mr GPE
CARDINAL . Following a decision on admissibility , on DATE ORG sent the appeal to the court of appeal for consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court suspended the proceedings in the case upon the applicants ' request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered resumption of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found in the applicants ' favour .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON and Mr O.O. appealed . On DATE the court of appeal quashed the first instance court judgment and found against the applicants .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected that appeal as unsubstantiated .

CARDINAL . Out of QUANTITY hearings in the case CARDINAL were adjourned upon the applicants ' request or due to their failure to appear , CARDINAL were adjourned upon the respondents ' requests or due to their failure to appear , and CARDINAL were adjourned due to the necessity to call a witness or to examine proof or information .
